intro: Vincetoxicum indicum, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
